Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Name: Vase
Description: Small vase with an oval-shaped body and a flared lip, but without a neck. The clay is fine, calcareous with a white grog and orange and is covered with a polished, brick-red coloured slip. A triple spiral motif was incised on the shoulder and a mark incised after firing was made on the body.
